title: [BUG] .NET Maui throws build exception on iOS
body:
**Description**

.NET Maui throws the following exception on iOS when I try to build my project 

```
Severity	Code	Description	Project	File	Line	Suppression State
Error		clang++ exited with code 1:
ld: framework not found System
clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)	Myproject	C:\Program Files\dotnet\packs\Microsoft.iOS.Sdk\16.2.1024\targets\Xamarin.Shared.Sdk.targets	1225	
```

**Code**

I tried with 
```xml
<AdditionalArgs>
    --linkskip=SkiaSharp.Extended.UI.Maui
</AdditionalArgs>
```


and by installing the other dependencies directly into the prject and then adding a LinkSkip like so:

```xml
 <Target Name="AddSkia" Condition="'$(TargetFramework)'=='net7.0-ios'" AfterTargets="_LoadLinkerOutput" BeforeTargets="_ComputeLinkNativeExecutableInputs">
		<ItemGroup>
			<_LinkerFrameworks Include="SkiaSharp" />
			<_LinkerFrameworks Include="SkiaSharp.Views.Maui.Controls" />
			<_LinkerFrameworks Include="SkiaSharp.Extended.UI.Maui" />
			<_LinkerFrameworks Include="SkiaSharp.Views.Maui.Core" />
		</ItemGroup>
	</Target> 
```

getting the same error...


**Basic Information**

- Version with issue:  2.0.0-preview 61
- Last known good version:  --
- IDE:  Visual Studio and Visual Studio for Mac 
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - iOS:  16.2, 14.3
- Target Devices:   <!-- the devices that you noticed this on, e.g. iPhone X -->
  - iPhone SE and X
  - Simulator
